examples: This is how it was with the old waddies, aint it?

entries.meaning: (Australia) A war club used by Aboriginal Australians; a nulla nulla.
examples: After waiting for some time, and nothing being done, I began to think that the settlement tribes were afraid of the mountaineers, whose chosen warriors advanced in a line, striking their shields with their waddies, singing their war-cry, wa-ah ! wa-ah ! wa-ah ! aa-ho ! aa-ho ! aa-ho ! hi-hi-hi !—I should have told you that many of the Amity Paint tribe, which is more numerous than the other two settlement tribes, were deficient of spears and shields, having nothing but waddies and boomerangs.

entries.meaning: (Australia) A piece of wood; a stick or peg; also, a walking stick.

verbs.description: waddy (third-person singular simple present waddies, present participle waddying, simple past and past participle waddied)

entries.meaning: (Australia, transitive) To attack or beat with an Aboriginal war club.
